ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Age in Years
Have you ever been diagnosed with bipolar disorder by a medical professional?
What type of Bipolar Disorder have you been diagnosed with?
Notes: 1=Type I; 2=Type II; 3=Bipolar Disorder Not Otherwise Specified; 4=Cyclothymia; 5=I do not know

ElementDescription: At what age were you diagnosed with bipolar disorder?
Notes: 1=Under 12 years of age; 2=12-18 years of age; 3=19-29 years old; 4=30-39 years old; 5=40-49 years old; 6=50 years old or older

ElementDescription: Have you ever been hospitalized as a result of a mood episode?
In which state do you currently live?
Notes: 1=Alabama; 2=Alaska; 3=Arizona; 4=Arkansas; 5=California; 6=Colorado; 7=Connecticut; 8=Delaware; 9=Florida; 10=Georgia; 11=Hawaii; 12=Idaho; 13=Illinois; 14=Indiana; 15=Iowa; 16=Kansas; 17=Kentucky; 18=Louisiana; 19=Maine; 20=Maryland; 21=Massachusetts; 22=Michigan; 23=Minnesota; 24=Mississippi; 25=Missouri; 26=Montana; 27=Nebraska; 28=Nevada; 29=New Hampshire; 30=New Jersey; 31=New Mexico; 32=New York; 33=North Carolina; 34=North Dakota; 35=Ohio; 36=Oklahoma; 37=Oregon; 38=Pennsylvania; 39=Rhode Island; 40=South Carolina; 41=South Dakota; 42=Tennessee; 43=Texas; 44=Utah; 45=Vermont; 46=Virginia; 47=Washington; 48=West Virginia; 49=Wisconsin; 50=Wyoming; 51=US territory of American Samoa, Guam, N. Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, or US Virgin Islands

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes the area where you live?
Which best describes your current marital status?
Notes: 1=Single, never married; 2=Married without children; 3=Married with children; 4=Divorced; 5=Separated; 6=Widowed; 7=Living with a partner; 8=In a relationship, not living together

ElementDescription: Please indicate the highest level of education completed.
Notes: 1=Primary school; 2=Secondary/high school (or equivalent); 3=Vocational/technical school (2 year); 4=Some university; 5=University graduate (4 year); 6=Master's degree (MS); 7=Professional or doctorate degree (MD, PhD, JD, etc.); 8=Other

ElementDescription: What is your current employment status?
Notes: 1=Employed full time (35 or more hours per week); 2=Employed part time (up to 35 hours per week); 3=Unemployed and currently looking for work; 4=Unemployed and not currently looking for work; 5=Student and not working; 6=Retired; 7=Homemaker/Stay at home parent; 8=Self-Employed; 9=Unable to work, receiving disability benefits; 10=Unable to work, without receiving disability benefits

ElementDescription: What is your current annual individual income? (USD)
Do you currently have a bank account (e.g., checking account)?
Do you currently have a savings account?
Have you ever used a ''buy now, pay later'' service when shopping online?
Which of the following best describes the main goal you are currently working towards with your finances?
Notes: 1=To reduce impulsive spending; 2=To avoid accruing debt; 3=To build up my savings/emergency fund/retirement; 4=To remember to pay my bills on time; 5=To pay off debt (student loans, credit cards, etc.); 6=To work towards a large purchase (buying a house, car, tuition, business etc.)

ElementDescription: The app uses your financial data so that it can share your spending behavior patterns with your clinicians during a mood episode. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can share your spending behavior patterns with your clinicians when your mood is stable. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can share your spending behavior patterns with your care partners during a mood episode. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can share your spending behavior patterns with your care partners when your mood is stable. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can share your spending behavior patterns with your banks and creditors during a mood episode. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can share your spending behavior patterns with your banks and creditors when your mood is stable. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can enable your clinicians to help you with planning and budgeting during a mood episode. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can enable your clinicians to help you with planning and budgeting when your mood is stable. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can enable your care partners to help you with planning and budgeting during a mood episode. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can enable your care partners to help you with planning and budgeting when your mood is stable. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can enable your banks and creditors to help you with planning and budgeting during a mood episode. How comfortable are you with this scenario?
The app uses your financial data so that it can enable your banks and creditors to help you with planning and budgeting when your mood is stable. How comfortable are you with this scenario?

The app will use your financial data to identify risky behaviors so that it can enable your care partners to restrict your spending for the next 48 hours during a mood episode. How comfortable are you with this scenario?

The app will use your financial data to identify risky behaviors so that It can  enable your care partners to restrict your spending for the next 48 hours when your mood is stable. How comfortable are you with this scenario?

Because of my money situation, I feel like I will never have the things I want in life. How well does this statement describe you or your situation?
I am just getting by financially. How well does this statement describe you or your situation?
I am concerned that the money I have or will save won't last. How well does this statement describe you or your situation?
I have money left over at the end of the month. How often does this statement apply to you?
My finances control my life. How often does this statement apply to you?
Have you ever had to declare bankruptcy/discharge debts due to large purchases or impulsive spending when you are manic?
Have you ever considered declaring bankruptcy/discharge debts due to large purchases or impulsive spending when you are manic?

A psychiatric advanced directive is a document that allows you to make choices in advance about mental treatment in the event you are unable to make decisions. Have you ever created a psychiatric advanced directive?
Have you ever asked your care partners to help you prevent impulsive spending or manage your finances?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Continually make financial decisions on my behalf?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Make financial decisions for me during specific periods of time (e.g., during episodes, specific events, etc.)?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Monitor my finances only (without decision-making abilities)?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Having regular meetings to discuss my spending and long-term financial goals?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Periodically asking advice (e.g., before big decisions, large purchases, etc.)?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Having someone to spend time with me or distract me from spending money?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: None of these?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Other?
Which of the following have you used with other people to help manage your spending: Other (specify)

Please rate how easy you find it to trust your clinician/therapist.
Notes: 1=Extremely difficult; 2=Somewhat difficult; 3=Neither easy nor difficult; 4=Somewhat easy; 5=Extremely easy

ElementDescription: Please rate how easy you find it to trust your banks/creditors.
Notes: 1=Extremely difficult; 2=Somewhat difficult; 3=Neither easy nor difficult; 4=Somewhat easy; 5=Extremely easy

ElementDescription: Please rate how easy you find it to trust your care partners.
Notes: 1=Extremely difficult; 2=Somewhat difficult; 3=Neither easy nor difficult; 4=Somewhat easy; 5=Extremely easy
